page.title: 10Farming Problems in Dyfed
page.content: Farmers always grumble that we know,but perhaps their present grievances are justified. Dairy farmers here naturally find that the EEC milk quota system imposed on them, has hampered plans for expansion, eroded their independence and enerally has far-reaching repercussions on prices - some profits down by half. Others who have decided to rear their bull calves instead of selling at a few weeks olds, will have to wait 18 months for any proit from them. Alternatively the beef and sheep men are forecasting a glut of their products as more dairy farmers branch out into their field. They also feel aggrievated that they, on the other hand, cannot decide to keep a small dairy herd as they have no quota. Their profits are already down.
